decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and various lands to generate huge amounts of mana and play multiple lands per turn. The key strategy revolves around tutoring for Primeval Titan with Summoner's Pact to search for specific lands like The Mycosynth Gardens or utility lands like Bojuka Bog. The deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces to quickly ramp up mana, play Primeval Titan, and fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a wide range of creatures with varying abilities to support the combo strategy. It includes cards that tutor for specific creatures or provide sacrifice outlets to trigger powerful effects. The deck aims to control the board through creature interactions and generate value through sacrificing creatures and exploiting death triggers. It has a toolbox approach, where players can search for specific creatures to fit the current game state and execute the combo to overwhelm the opponent. The deck's strategy revolves around leveraging the synergy between creatures to create a powerful win condition.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to get out powerful spells and creatures. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to accelerate mana production, while also benefiting from the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and lands that allow for multiple land drops like The One Ring. The goal is to eventually bring out powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West to further enhance its game plan.

The main concept of this UrzaTron deck is to control the game with powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger while assembling the Urza lands (Power Plant, Mine, Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the deck to play big spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator ahead of schedule. The deck also utilizes cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find the Urza lands efficiently, ensuring a consistent and strong late-game presence.

This deck focuses on control through a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six, along with versatile removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue opponents. The inclusion of Omnath, Locus of Creation adds a strong win condition that can quickly close out games. The deck also includes Leyline Binding to disrupt opponents' strategies and Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion for additional synergy and utility.

The deck focuses on assembling a versatile toolbox of creatures with the ability to combo off for powerful synergies. It utilizes Yawgmoth, Thran Physician as a central piece to generate card advantage and control the board. The creatures in the deck offer resilience and value, while cards like Chord of Calling help in tutoring for specific creatures needed for different situations. With access to sacrifice outlets and incremental advantage engines, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its synergistic abilities while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on assembling a diverse array of creatures with unique abilities to create powerful synergies and combos. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can tutor for specific creatures and manipulate the board state to its advantage. The creatures in the deck serve as both combo pieces and tools to control the game, allowing the player to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver opponents. The Toolbox aspect of the deck provides flexibility and strategic depth, enabling the player to efficiently handle various threats and win conditions.

The main concept of this Modern Control deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Overgrowth in order to cast powerful creatures like Karn, the Great Creator and Garruk Wildspeaker. The deck also utilizes control elements like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival to maintain board control. The win condition is to ultimately cast Tooth and Nail to search for The One Ring and other key creatures like Cavalier of Thorns to overwhelm the opponent. Delighted Halfling provides additional card advantage while Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx boosts mana production.

The deck focuses on aggressively deploying creatures with powerful abilities and utilizing Leylines to control the battlefield. It combines a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan and Wild Nacatl with powerful spells like Tribal Flames for added reach. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to protect your creatures and maintain board presence. The inclusion of Scion of Draco adds a high-powered finisher to close out games quickly. Stubborn Denial provides protection against removal spells, while Dromoka's Command can help deal with problematic permanents. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures with aggressive abilities and combat stats, supported by a mix of removal and protection spells. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and consistency to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a wide range of colors necessary for the deck's powerful spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and maintain pressure throughout the game with a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards with multicolored mana symbols to take advantage of Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames for powerful aggro plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with efficient creatures like Scion of Draco and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also providing protection with Stubborn Denial. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and additional mana to further fuel the aggressive strategy. By combining efficient creatures and powerful spells, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as fast as possible. By using cards that support a diverse range of colors, the deck can take advantage of Tribal Flames to deal significant damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Leyline binding and Leyline of the Guildpact helps to further boost the overall strength of the creatures. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional mana ramp and flexibility to adapt to different situations.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with unique abilities to combo off and generate value. Cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide are key pieces of the combo, allowing for frequent creature sacrifices and recursion. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Zulaport Cutthroat provide additional value and drain opponents. Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution help tutor for specific creatures when needed. The deck aims to control the board with its toolbox of creatures and eventually overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on quickly gaining life through Martyr of Sands and using it to fuel powerful spells like Ranger-Captain of Eos, Solitude, and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines. It also includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Supreme Verdict to control the board. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and The One Ring provides additional ways to protect your life total while generating value. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while also providing utility lands like Emeria, the Sky Ruin and Field of Ruin.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells and control the game. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production and consistently hit land drops. The deck includes a toolbox of versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Supreme Verdict to deal with various threats, while also having the potential to win through combos such as Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck's control elements and ability to shift gears between controlling the board and setting up a game-winning combo make it a versatile and powerful choice in Modern 1 vs 1.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt, Counterspell, and Expressive Iteration to control the board while also putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. It also utilizes powerful synergies such as Mishra's Bauble and Unholy Heat to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of tempo plays and efficient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber, in combination with Amulet of Vigor. This allows for explosive plays and the ability to quickly bring out big threats like Primeval Titan. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Tolaria West and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to control the board and generate additional value. Overall, the key strategy is to assemble the right pieces to quickly bring out powerful threats and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on using the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and lands that produce multiple mana to facilitate the fast and efficient ramping into Primeval Titan. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces to tutor for lands, generate extra mana, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or multiple Primeval Titans. Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove help facilitate the mana acceleration, while cards like Summoner's Pact and Tolaria West provide additional consistency to the combo strategy. The deck aims to win through explosive land-based combos and overwhelming board presence.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief while also having removal options like Fatal Push. The deck also includes creatures like Stalactite Stalker and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure on the opponent. In addition, there are recursion options with Unearth and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to bring back key creatures. The deck aims to control the board and continuously apply pressure to overwhelm the opponent swiftly.

This deck focuses on utilizing Cascade mechanics to quickly and efficiently cast powerful spells for minimal mana cost. By cascading into high-impact spells like Crashing Footfalls, Shardless Agent, and Scion of Draco, the deck overwhelms opponents with a consistent stream of threats. The inclusion of cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps protect the board state while simultaneously disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to aggressively cascade into game-winning threats while maintaining control of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on assembling a wide variety of creature options to create combos and generate value. The creatures in the deck serve multiple purposes, from providing mana acceleration and card advantage to disrupting the opponent's game plan. By tutoring for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and utilizing the toolbox of creatures available, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and resilient board presence. Additionally, the deck has some graveyard interaction and sacrifice synergies to take advantage of various creature abilities and create additional win conditions.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with powerful abilities to create a dynamic toolbox of options. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution, players can search for the perfect creature for any situation. The deck also includes combos involving cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate value and advantage. Overall, the key strategy revolves around using a combination of creature abilities to control the board and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off with various synergies and abilities. It utilizes creatures like Young Wolf and Walking Ballista to generate value and create advantageous board states. The deck also includes key combo pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate card advantage and control the board. The mix of creatures and spells, along with the ability to tutor for creatures with Chord of Calling, allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups.

This deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to enhance the +1/+1 counters on creatures, creating a powerful aggro strategy. By playing creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp alongside artifacts like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker, the deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm opponents with large, synergistic creatures. The inclusion of cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and The Ozolith allows for additional ways to manipulate counters and benefit from creature removal, while Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga help to search for key pieces to further enhance the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing powerful creatures back from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. By combining these instant reanimation spells with cards like Ephemerate and Fallaji Archaeologist, players can cheat creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand, while using Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide additional support and protection for the combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, then use cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist to bring them back onto the battlefield for rapid and unexpected wins. This combo-oriented Instant Reanimator strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats early in the game, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Grief and Solitude to control the board and disrupt the opponent's gameplan. The deck also includes a mix of removal and card draw spells to provide flexibility and consistency in executing its gameplan.

This deck focuses on quickly putting creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa onto the battlefield from your graveyard using Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate for explosive plays. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's strategy with cards like Solitude and Grief while setting up your own game-winning combo. Tainted Indulgence allows you to draw additional cards while Faithful Mending helps you filter through your deck. Force of Negation and Thoughtseize provide additional disruption against your opponent. Prismatic Ending deals with troublesome permanents, while Fallaji Archaeologist helps you return key cards from your graveyard to your hand.

This aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan and Grief to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure. By combining hand disruption, removal spells like Fatal Push, and strong threats like Sheoldred and Kroxa, the deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The deck's strategy revolves around maintaining a fast and relentless pace, punishing opponents for slow starts and overwhelming them with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to protect key threats like The One Ring and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to establish dominance and win the game through powerful cards and strategic plays. The deck also includes various utility lands to support its overall game plan and provide flexibility in different matchups. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and powerful late-game threats to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook to sacrifice creatures and generate value, while also utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Ovalchase Daredevil to recur creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to be aggressive by sacrificing creatures for card advantage and dealing damage to the opponent. It also includes recursion and graveyard manipulation cards to ensure a steady flow of threats. Additionally, it utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts and generate additional value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent through a combination of aggressive creature plays and graveyard synergies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and board wipes while using Teferi planeswalkers to generate card advantage and tempo. The deck also includes powerful enchantments like Leyline Binding and The One Ring to further control the battlefield. By efficiently answering threats and establishing a strong defense, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional utility and serves as a backup plan for resilience against certain strategies.
